{"name":"Spiced Beef & Feta Fusion Pastries","difficulty":"hard","diet":"halal","kind_of_food":"fusion","prep_time":"30 minutes","cook_time":"25 minutes","ingredients":["300g halal ground beef","1 puff pastry sheet","1/2 cup crumbled feta","1 red bell pepper, diced","1/2 cup caramelized onions","1/4 cup black olives, sliced","1 tbsp harissa sauce","2 tbsp chopped fresh parsley","1 egg (for egg wash)"],"steps":["Preheat oven to 200°C (390°F).","Brown the ground beef in a skillet and drain excess fat.","Add peppers, onions, olives, harissa, and cook for 5 mins.","Stir in feta and parsley, let cool.","Cut puff pastry into rectangles. {"name":"Creamy Classic Hummus Platter","difficulty":"easy","diet":"vegan","kind_of_food":"middle eastern","prep_time":"10 minutes","cook_time":"0 minutes","ingredients":["2 cups cooked chickpeas","1/3 cup tahini","2 tbsp lemon juice","2 cloves garlic","3 tbsp olive oil","1/2 tsp ground cumin","1/2 tsp salt","Pita bread, for serving","Chopped fresh parsley, for garnish"],"steps":["In a food processor, combine chickpeas, tahini, lemon juice, garlic, cumin, and salt.","Blend until smooth, slowly adding 2 tbsp olive oil and a few tbsp of water to adjust texture.","Taste and adjust seasoning as needed.","Scoop hummus into a serving bowl and smooth the top with the back of a spoon.","Drizzle the remaining 1 tbsp of olive oil over the top and sprinkle with chopped parsley.","Serve with warm pita bread or veggie sticks."],"tips":["For creamier hummus, peel the chickpeas after cooking.","Add a pinch of smoked paprika for a smoky flavor.","Store leftovers in an airtight container in the fridge for up to 4 days."]}

{"name":"Palak Paneer with Basmati Rice","difficulty":"medium","diet":"vegetarian","kind_of_food":"indian","prep_time":"20 minutes","cook_time":"30 minutes","ingredients":["200g paneer, cubed","4 cups spinach leaves","2 medium tomatoes, chopped","1 onion, finely chopped","2 cloves garlic, minced","1-inch piece of ginger, grated","1 tsp cumin seeds","1 tsp garam masala","1/4 cup cream (optional)","2 tbsp oil or ghee","Salt to taste","1 cup basmati rice","2 cups water"],"steps":["Wash and soak basmati rice for 15 minutes. Boil 2 cups of water in a pot, add rice and a pinch of salt, cover and simmer for 12–15 minutes until fluffy.","Blanch spinach in boiling water for 2 minutes, then transfer to cold water. Drain and blend into a smooth puree.","In a pan, heat oil/ghee. Add cumin seeds and let them crackle.","Add chopped onion and sauté until golden brown.","Stir in garlic and ginger, cooking for 1 minute until fragrant.","Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they break down and become saucy.","Stir in garam masala and salt, mix well.","Pour in the spinach puree and cook on medium heat for 5–6 minutes.","Add paneer cubes and cook another 5 minutes, stirring gently to coat.","Add cream for extra richness if desired, and stir to combine.","Serve hot with basmati rice."],"tips":["Use tofu instead of paneer for a vegan version.","Add green chilies for heat.","Soak paneer in warm water before cooking to keep it soft."]}
